document_title: Chronic liver failure: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Chronic liver failure can take months to years to develop noticeable symptoms, unless diagnostic tests are performed early. Some identifying signs include: (2)
Tired body.; Mild fever; Digestive disorders.; Jaundice.; Bleeding under the skin.; Abnormal weight loss.; Edema or fluid accumulation in the legs; Ascites.
